review_title: So much invested time, and for a good reason!
pros:
In the position I was in, I had the opportunity to work collaboratively with different departments. If you wanted to make something happen, you could find someone willing to jump behind you, support you, and help you achieve what you wanted to achieve. 

I had the opportunity to affect change in the day to day lives of students.

Students, faculty, and staff were appreciative and supportive of the time you invested in them.
cons:
There were some people who got a bit of a power trip, but they're no longer there. They usually can't stay there. 

There was stress to uphold the university standards, but ultimately it drove you to work harder and to align yourself with the mission and vision of the university.  

You have those people everywhere.

pros: The people here really care. Most of the faculty here care deeply about the students. Very inclusive environment.
cons: The administration only focuses on the short-term and pushes bigger problems down the road. No vision for the future of academia. Still believe that we are in the 1950's. Salaries out of line with market salaries which is why new faculty typically stay for less than 3-4 years; thus, the school is very dependent on adjunct/temporary help.
